title: Gravitational Force - force on an object rising to

content.description: An object is thrown upwards from the surface of a small moon of radius <math alttext="Uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math>. The object rises to a height <math alttext="3 uppercase R" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></math> above the surface of the moon before returning to the surface.
content.question: Assuming frictional forces are negligible, which of the following forces are exerted on the object while it is on the way up?

choices.label: Only a decreasing gravitational force that is exerted downward
Only an increasing gravitational force that is exerted downward
Only a constant gravitational force that is exerted downward
Both a constant gravitational force exerted downward and a decreasing force that acts upward

content.answer: Only a decreasing gravitational force that is exerted downward

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
